page.title: 05THE MOUNTS
page.content: Mounts, or The Mounts as it is usually known, is a rather straggling small settlement built along the only main road in the survey area, the A 381 Totnes to Kingsbridge road. Several of the older houses have walls protected by hung slates, a testimony to the high exposed position of the settlement. Only two of the houses date from before the turn of century. Six council houses are at the northern end and at the southern end are two quite modern houses. There is no church, shop or school, East Allington, a mile to the east, provides these services. There is a public telephone box and a letter box. Also there is a daily bus service to Kingsbridge and Totnes. There is a camping and caravan site, a skip hire service and a haulage firm.
